home.img1-title: PHOTOGRAPHER, OBSERVER AND PASSIONATE ABOUT CONSCIOUS JOURNEYS
home.img1-p1: It might have happened to you, and I'm truly sorry for that. I know it must have been hard. But no, it never happened to me. I never lost the photos from Tuenti because I was the one who carried the camera. An Olympus compact, which I still keep and cherish, even though it no longer works.
home.img1-p2: Drinking a Fanta and having some sunflower seeds on the park bench, during the Carnival celebrations and the Coslada festivals, but always with the camera in hand, back when there were no phones with decent cameras.
home.img1-p3: Sometimes my friends hate me for bringing certain photos to light again. But they still enjoy it. They are memories, and they are quality memories. However, I remember perfectly the day when my brain went BING! and I knew that the camera and photography were going to be my allies for the rest of my life.
home.img1-p4: One day with my friends at the Warner Park in Madrid, with those sets simulating a dark street in the Spiderman's New York, I set the timer, and we all posed as if we were a music band. I was amazed at how they turned out, and then at home, I edited them with PhotoScape and WOW. So many cool stuff you can do!!
home.img1-p5: And after a few years... my first DSLR camera. A basic Canon kit that accompanied me on my first trips: the United States, Canada, Ireland, Thailand, Lisbon...
home.img1-p6: And here I am. With updated gear, also occasionally doing engagement and wedding photography, but with the same passion and excitement as with that Olympus.
home.img1-p7: I hope you can enjoy on this website what has been this photography journey for me.
